Articles.Content: One of the German occupations of Paris?
No. I'm afraid not.
The liberation of the concentration camps?

I guess it's time for a hint. It happened on one of the newly discovered continents.

new page repost.

Thousands of men marched into the city on this day,

Bomb upon bomb, yet no explosion.

Shots fired in the dark night, yet no casualties.

Seen a rebellion, but no invasion.

People lived through the occupation to turn in a few bucks.

What was this day?
Oh, hang on, is it the Manhattan Project? Or the Trinity Test specifically?
landing on the moon?
Tianamen Square Protest of 1980?
None of those I'm afraid. This event still happened during one of the World Wars.

Thinking over it again,

"Bomb upon bomb, yet no explosion.

Shots fired in the dark night, yet no casualties."

Maybe that refers to flashes, and the 'shots' are photographs. But we've been told it's not a celebration so that counts out a lot of the obvious guesses. And if it's in the Americas that rules out most of combat-related events of either World War, otherwise I'd think something to do with aerial photography.
Photos bombing? So shots as in photos were does that happen the most?... Disney?
Doomsday?
An accidental bomb-dropping?

Thinking over it again,

"Bomb upon bomb, yet no explosion.

Shots fired in the dark night, yet no casualties."

Maybe that refers to flashes, and the 'shots' are photographs. But we've been told it's not a celebration so that counts out a lot of the obvious guesses. And if it's in the Americas that rules out most of combat-related events of either World War, otherwise I'd think something to do with aerial photography.

That's quite clever, but I'm not that smart unfortunately.

I'll add a couple of lines:

Thousands of men marched into the city on this day,

Bomb upon bomb, yet no explosion.

Shots fired in the dark night, yet no casualties.

Seen a rebellion, but no invasion.

People lived through the occupation to turn in a few bucks.

The guys in the south have their toons and flicks,

but here, it's like the real thing.

What was this day?
Some sort of military exercise? But I don't know any specific ones.

disney world in california

- - - Updated - - -

or land i dont know i dont live there
The Bonus March?
Film festival?
Hm. 4th of July? Just reminds me a lot of fireworks and parades.

Barrel O'Hints:

Happened during one of the World Wars.

(Ah! Spider on my glasses!)

Happened in one of the newly discovered continents.

Not really a celebration.
New relative to what?
By "world wars", do you mean the iconic ones, or something a little... older?

This event in mind happened during one of the iconic world wars.

Not-so New Hint!:

It happened in L'amerique du Nord.
This kinda sounds like the Conscription Crisis, but I can't say for a sure. I'm a little uneducated in that field.
The invasion and occupation of Iceland?
Troops returning home? Shore leave?
